Title IX is a federal law that prohibits discrimination on the basis of sex in any education program or activity that receives federal funding. The law requires that schools provide equal opportunities and treatment for male and female student-athletes in their athletic programs. While the law does not require schools to provide the same number of athletic opportunities for male and female students, it does require that any disparities in opportunities be justified by factors other than sex.
In this case, Adams High School has a disproportionate number of male and female students, with an equal number of male and female students overall. In conclusion, Adams High School's decision to eliminate both the boys' and girls' soccer teams in order to save money does not comply with Title IX.
